Khan went missing in Nairobi in the third week of July. Meanwhile, actor Karan Kundrra also took to Twitter and urged people to sign a petition to find the former Balaji COO.

349.title: Pot of coins dug up in Kuno park, Palpur royal descendant stakes claim
349.article_body: A pot of die-struck copper and silver coins was unearthed on Wednesday by workers digging inside Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park, where PM Narendra Modi recently released eight cheetahs. The workers reportedly distributed the coins among themselves. Palpur royal family's descendent, RK Shreegopal Deo Singh Palpur, said the coins belong to his family. Palpur fortress is located in the park.

350.title: Halep releases statement after being suspended for doping, says 'Biggest shock of my life'
350.article_body: Former world number one women's tennis player Simona Halep has released a statement after being suspended for doping. Calling it "the biggest shock of my life", Halep said, "Facing such an unfair situation, I feel completely confused and betrayed." She added, "I will fight until the end to prove that I never knowingly took any prohibited substance."

351.title: Solicitor General made false claims for political motives: Chhattisgarh CM
351.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Friday said, "It is extremely unfortunate that a person...like Solicitor General [Tushar Mehta] is making false and mischievous allegations for political motives." The ED had earlier claimed that a judge had met Baghel two days before bail was granted to some accused in a money laundering case. "I have never met the judge," Baghel added.

352.title: BJP-led govt very unpopular among people of Himachal: Bhupesh Baghel
352.article_body: Ahead of Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh, senior observer of Congress for the state, Bhupesh Baghel, said that Jairam Thakur government has become very unpopular among the people. "There are issues like unemployment, inflation in the state and people have made up their minds about change," Baghel said. "I believe when results are declared, Congress will win there," he added.

353.title: I'd go with Shami: Moody on India's 3rd pacer ahead of T20 WC match vs Pak
353.article_body: Ahead of India-Pakistan Super 12 stage match in T20 World Cup 2022, Tom Moody said he'd pick Mohammad Shami as third pacer in India's playing XI. "He's a big player with a lot of experience," he added. "Obviously, Bhuvi (Bhuvneshwar Kumar)...Arshdeep Singh are the first two," stated Moody. Shami posted 3/4 in the last over against Australia in warm-up match.

354.title: 'Brahmastra' VFX team to work on Hrithik & Deepika's 'Fighter': Report
354.article_body: Double Negative (DNEG), the VFX company that worked on the visual effects of 'Brahmastra', has been roped in to work on the movie 'Fighter', according to a report. The upcoming movie is an aerial action thriller which will be directed by Siddharth Anand. 'Fighter', starring Hrithik Roshan and Deepika Padukone, is set to release in theatres on September 28, 2023.

355.title: Such things happen: Parineeti on rejecting Ranbir's 'Animal' for Imtiaz's film
355.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra has opened up about opting out of Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Animal' for Imtiaz Ali's film. "These things happen, it is a part and parcel of life. We must make such choices every day. You make the choice that is right for you," she said. 'Animal' will also feature Rashmika Mandanna, Anil Kapoor and Bobby Deol.

356.title: Major setback for Indian consumers: Google on being fined ₹1,338 crore in India
356.article_body: Google issued a statement a day after the Competition Commission of India (CCI) imposed a ₹1,338-crore fine on it for 'anti-competitive practices'. Saying that Android supports "thousands of businesses in India", Google called CCI's move "a major setback" for Indian consumers and businesses. The move opened "serious security risks" and raised the cost of mobile devices for Indians, it added.

357.title: Former world number one Simona Halep provisionally suspended for doping
357.article_body: Former world number one women's tennis player Simona Halep has been provisionally suspended for doping. The two-time Grand Slam champion tested positive for the banned substance roxadustat, the International Tennis Integrity Agency (ITIA) said on Friday. Halep was tested during US Open 2022 and both her A and B samples confirmed the presence of the drug.

358.title: WWE legend Kevin Nash's son Tristen Nash passes away aged 26
358.article_body: WWE Hall of Famer Kevin Nash's son Tristen Nash has passed away aged 26. Tristen, who was a musician and poet, was Kevin and Tamara McMichael's only child. The cause of his death hasn't been disclosed to public. Condoling Tristen's demise, Matt Hardy tweeted, "My thoughts are with Kevin & his family following the passing of his son...It's absolutely tragic."

359.title: Man caught with elephant ivory gets life sentence in Uganda
359.article_body: A Ugandan court has awarded life imprisonment to a man caught with nearly 10 kg of elephant ivory, the country's highest punishment ever for wildlife violations, authorities said on Friday. The convict was sentenced to life as he was found to be a "habitual offender", having served 18 months in jail for a similar offence earlier, Uganda Wildlife Authority informed.

360.title: Chennai Police launch mobile app to provide real-time traffic updates
360.article_body: Chennai Police Commissioner Shankar Jiwal on Thursday launched a mobile application, roadEase, to provide real-time updates on road closures and diversions, estimated travel times and alternative routes. "[The app] will be able to deploy the information on Google Maps within 15 minutes and the closed road will be shown with the dotted red line," a press release from police stated.

361.title: AIIMS Delhi withdraws order on SOPs for special medical treatment of MPs
361.article_body: Delhi's All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) has withdrawn all Standard Operating Procedures issued for special medical treatment of MPs, with immediate effect. The order issued earlier was criticised by doctors, who called it "VIP culture". "A voice of reason, rationale and resolve can make a big difference," the Federation of Resident Doctors' Association (FORDA) said on Friday.

362.title: 65-yr-old woman drowns at TN home amid rains; 275 houses inundated
362.article_body: A 65-year-old woman, who was sleeping at her residence, drowned after water gushed into her house following heavy rainfall in Tamil Nadu's Erode district on Friday. Around 275 houses in various parts of the district were reportedly left inundated. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecasted heavy rainfall and thunderstorm in the state till October 23.

363.title: 30 people injured after tent collapses during science fair in Kerala
363.article_body: As many as 30 people, including students and teachers, were injured on Friday when a temporary tent put up as part of a science fair collapsed at a school in Kerala's Kasargod, police said. "The injured...have been shifted to various hospitals nearby in various ambulances and private vehicles," police said. "The shed wasn't strong enough," locals said.

364.title: ED freezes Bitcoins worth ₹7.12 crore in E-nuggets gaming app case
364.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has frozen Bitcoins worth ₹7.12 crore and seized ₹1.65 crore in cash as part of its probe in the E-nuggets gaming app case, officials said. The app was allegedly designed to defraud the public. "The ED carried out a search operation at two premises in Kolkata, leading to the seizure," the agency said in a statement.

365.title: 157 trees will be transplanted for 2 new blocks at IIT-D: CM Kejriwal
365.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said the proposal to construct two new academic blocks at the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IIT-D), which will require the transplantation of 157 trees, has been approved. As per plans, a new engineer block and a mini academic block will be constructed. "Our government will leave no stone unturned...for our students," Kejriwal said.

366.title: Broadcasters unwilling to pay what women's football deserves: FIFA
366.article_body: After FIFA rejected several bids for the 2023 Women's World Cup broadcast rights, the body's Chief Business Officer Romy Gai said that the bids did not reflect the popularity of women's football. "This is...[a] testament...of broadcasters [unwilling] to pay what the women's game deserves...The WC 2019...was a catalyst for change in terms of the TV audience," Gai said.

367.title: Pune Police arrests 6 people for stealing motorcycle silencers
367.article_body: The Crime Branch of Pune Police has arrested six people from Hadapsar in the Pune district for stealing motorcycle silencers. The accused allegedly extracted platinum dust from the silencers and sold it to jewellers. "We had been getting complaints related to theft of motorcycle silencers from Hadapsar, Uruli Devachi, Phursungi, Shewalwadi and Mundhwa areas," said Police Inspector Hemant Patil.

368.title: Rahul will interact with all sections of society during T'gana stay: Cong MP
368.article_body: Telangana Congress MP Uttam Kumar Reddy said Rahul Gandhi would interact with all sections of society during his stay in Telangana during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from October 23 to November 7. "Bharat Jodo Yatra has been receiving tremendous response from all sections of society," Reddy said. "This will be...more successful in Telangana compared to other states," he added.

369.title: Bengaluru to receive heavy rains & thunderstorms until October 23: IMD
369.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted thunderstorms and heavy rains in Bengaluru on October 22 and 23. The department has also issued a yellow alert in the city until Friday. According to IMD, Bengaluru received 60.5 mm of rain between Wednesday night and the early hours of Thursday, with Hampi Nagar ward receiving the most rainfall at 85.5 mm.

370.title: Bengaluru's Namma metro conducts trial run from Whitefield to ITPL
370.article_body: Bengaluru's Namma Metro started its trial run from Whitefield to ITPL on Friday. The stretch, which is part of the Purple line, witnessed a six-car train being operated along the route to check for structural obstructions. Notably, the Purple line will connect Mysore Road in the west to Whitefield in the east after it gets fully functional.

371.title: Man breaks Guinness World Record for 'farthest eyeball pop' in Brazil, pic viral
371.article_body: Sidney de Carvalho Mesquita has set the Guinness World Record for the farthest eyeball pop (male). Sidney made this record with a protrusion of 18.2 mm (0.71 inches) beyond his eye sockets. The record was verified in Sao Paulo, Brazil in January. The medical term for when an eyeball protrudes or "pops" out of the eye socket is 'globe luxation'.

372.title: Rusty country-made revolvers found abandoned at Hyd's Public Gardens
372.article_body: Rusty revolvers were found abandoned at Hyderabad's Public Gardens on Friday afternoon. The country-made revolvers were found by workers of Horticulture Department while they were cleaning the area. The workers alerted Saifabad Police, who recovered the weapons. "We suspect someone might have bought these weapons from other states and concealed [them] in the trees," Inspector K Sathaiah said.

373.title: Where have we reached in the name of religion?: SC on hate speeches
373.article_body: The Supreme Court, while hearing a plea against hate speeches, said, "Where have we reached in the name of religion? It is tragic." It said the statements of hate speech were "indeed disturbing", especially for India which is a democracy and religion-neutral. It issued notices to Delhi, Uttarakhand and UP governments to take suo motu cognisance of hate speech cases.

374.title: Consciously focusing on films, have taken break from OTT: Kirti Kulhari
374.article_body: Actress Kirti Kulhari said she has decided to take a break from OTT and focus on feature films. "I need to do something that really pushes me...I haven't really felt that coming in films for me," she said. "OTT...was doing so much for me...But this year I've consciously started focusing on films and...taken a little break from series," she added.

375.title: India successfully tests Agni Prime ballistic missile off Odisha coast
375.article_body: India successfully test-fired Agni Prime off the coast of Odisha on Friday. Defence officials said the new generation ballistic missile travelled its maximum range and the test established the accuracy and reliability of the system. Its performance was validated using data obtained by many range instrumentation, they added. It was the third consecutive successful test flight of the missile.

376.title: Allu Arjun's father announces film with 'Kantara' director-actor Rishab
376.article_body: Film producer Allu Aravind, father of actor Allu Arjun, has announced a film with Rishab Shetty, who wrote, directed and starred in the recently released movie 'Kantara'. "I've asked Rishab to do a film for Geetha Arts urgently, and he has immediately agreed," Aravind said at an event. 'Kantara' has grossed over ₹175 crore since its release on September 30.

377.title: Chhattisgarh CM meets Cong President-elect Kharge, extends wishes
377.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Friday met with the Congress President-elect Mallikarjun Kharge at his residence. Baghel tweeted that he greeted the President-elect and extended wishes to him. The newly elected President of the Indian National Congress, Mallikarjun Kharge, will take charge of the post on October 26 at All India Congress Committee (AICC) headquarters.

378.title: Over 20 ABVP activists try to storm Pragathi Bhavan in Hyd, arrested
378.article_body: Over 20 activists of Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) were arrested by Hyderabad Police for allegedly trying to storm Pragathi Bhavan, official residence of Telangana CM, on Friday. The activists were reportedly protesting against the hike in engineering fees in the state. The protesting activists were taken to Goshamahal Police Stadium where they were held as part of preventive custody.

379.title: It's a matter of pride to be the voice of Shri Ram: Sharad on 'Adipurush'
379.article_body: Actor Sharad Kelkar, who is set to voice actor Prabhas in the Hindi version of 'Adipurush', said, "For anyone in India, it's a matter of pride to be the voice of Shri Ram." Prabhas will portray Lord Ram in the upcoming movie. "I'm fortunate...to be...voice of Shri Ram and I got this chance, thanks to Om (Raut, director)," Sharad added.

380.title: Delhi's PM2.5 level for Jul-Aug-Sep quarter 2nd lowest in 5 yrs: CSE
380.article_body: This year Delhi's pollution average of PM2.5 for the July-August-September quarter was the second lowest in five years, the Centre for Science and Environment (CSE) said. The PM2.5 average in 2022 for this quarter was 37 microgram per cubic metre (Mg/M3). In the same quarter in 2020, the PM2.5 average was 36 Mg/M3.

381.title: Pune civic body disqualifies recruitment of 672 new employees
381.article_body: Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar has disqualified the recruitment of 672 new employees of the civic body. The government found that these recruitments were made fraudulently. The termination orders were given after Divisional Commissioner Saurabh Rao's enquiry report was submitted. Reportedly, many recruitments were made in exchange for large amounts of money.

382.title: He can win T20 World Cup on his own: Watson on Hardik Pandya
382.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya, former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said the India all-rounder can win the T20 World Cup on his own. "He's not just a finisher, he's a power hitter too. He's got all the skills...He's truly a match-winner," he added. India will face Pakistan in Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022 at Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday.

383.title: Incredible stuff: Jaffer on Ireland qualifying for Super 12s of T20 WC 2022
383.article_body: Reacting to Ireland qualifying for Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Incredible stuff Ireland, congratulations on making...Super 12s." He added, "Can't help but feel sad for West Indies though. [T20 World Cup] won't be the same without the Caribbean flavour." Meanwhile, Robin Uthappa tweeted, "Well done Ireland...Gotta feel for West Indies cricket though."

384.title: Real estate agent shot at by unidentified men at Thane petrol pump
384.article_body: A real estate agent was allegedly shot at by unidentified men at a petrol pump in Thane's Naupada. "Initially, it was noticed that the attack happened due to a property dispute but the probe is on," said the police, adding that the crime branch is parallelly looking into the matter. The victim was with colleagues when the attack took place.

385.title: It means everything: Ireland captain on reaching Super 12 stage in T20 WC
385.article_body: After Ireland's nine-wicket win over West Indies in Group B match clinched their place in the Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022, Ireland captain Andy Balbirnie said, "It means everything." He added, "We had a really disappointing loss last year at...same stage and we did a lot of thinking...It's just a really proud day to be Irish."

386.title: Man killed after JCB hits auto-rickshaw in Mumbai's Bandra
386.article_body: A 52-year-old man was killed after the auto-rickshaw he was travelling in was hit by a JCB machine from the side in Mumbai's Bandra. The JCB was reportedly stationed in the middle of the road and took a sudden reverse turn because of which it hit the rickshaw. The 22-year-old machine driver has been arrested.

387.title: Actress Vaishali Takkar's eyes donated before her cremation
387.article_body: Actress Vaishali Takkar's family donated her eyes before she was cremated on October 16. "Vaishali loved her eyes and often used to say that she would like to donate her eyes after her death,"  her cousin told India Today. The TV actress died by suicide at her residence and an alleged suicide note was found by police.

388.title: Gautam Gambhir names his Team India playing XI for match against Pakistan
388.article_body: Former India opener Gautam Gambhir has named his Team India playing XI for their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan. Gambhir chose Rishabh Pant over Dinesh Karthik. Other players in his XI include Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, Harshal Patel, Yuzvendra Chahal, Arshdeep Singh/Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Mohammad Shami.

389.title: Girls thrash man for peeping into their hostel washroom in MP
389.article_body: A man was thrashed by girls for allegedly peeping into their hostel washroom in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur. A purported video of the incident has gone viral on social media, where some girls are seen slapping a man and accusing him of misconduct. They also filed a police complaint against him, following which he was arrested.

390.title: Fire breaks out at banquet hall in Delhi's Rohini area
390.article_body: A fire broke out at a banquet hall in Sector 3 of northwest Delhi's Rohini on Friday afternoon, officials said. According to fire officials, the blaze was reported at 2:29 pm, upon which 13-14 fire tenders were rushed to the God Grace banquet hall. There were no immediate reports of casualties, as per officials.

391.title: Super 12 groups of T20 World Cup 2022 confirmed as Round 1 ends
391.article_body: The Super 12 groups of T20 World Cup 2022 have been finalised after Sri Lanka, Netherlands, Zimbabwe and Ireland advanced to the Super 12 stage following the Round 1. Sri Lanka and Ireland have made it to Group 1, while Netherlands and Zimbabwe are in Group 2, which also has teams like India, Pakistan and South Africa.

392.title: Video from site of Army helicopter crash in Arunachal Pradesh surfaces
392.article_body: A video has surfaced from the site where an Indian Army helicopter crashed in Arunachal Pradesh on Friday and it shows black smoke rising up from forests in the mountainous area. The Advanced Light Helicopter crashed 25 km from Tuting headquarters in the Upper Siang district of the northeastern state. At least two people died in the crash.

393.title: Man fakes own kidnapping to 'gain sympathy' from his 2 wives in Maha, arrested
393.article_body: A man was arrested in Maharashtra's Thane for faking his own kidnapping to gain sympathy from his two wives, police said. Sandip Gaikwad (36) was 'kidnapped' by three people who came in an autorickshaw and beat him up, as per his second wife's complaint. It was later discovered the trio were Sandip's friends who helped him fake the kidnapping.

394.title: Congress will form govt in MP in 2023, waive farm loans: Kamal Nath
394.article_body: While addressing a rally on Thursday, former CM of Madhya Pradesh Kamal Nath stated that Congress will form its government in the state after the Assembly elections in 2023. The Congress leader claimed the party will waive farmers' loans and restore the old pension scheme for state employees soon after forming the government. Nath-led Congress government had collapsed in 2020.

395.title: CBI court rejects Anil Deshmukh's bail plea in alleged corruption case
395.article_body: A special CBI court rejected a bail petition of former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in an alleged corruption case of ₹100 crore. He was arrested on November 2 of last year and has been held at Arthur Road Jail ever since. Earlier, an ex-Mumbai Police Commissioner had alleged that Deshmukh had given target to officers to collect ₹100 crore.

396.title: 3 persons, including a pedestrian, injured as tree falls in Thane
396.article_body: Three persons, including a pedestrian, were injured after a tree fell on them in Thane city, a civic official said on Friday. The incident occurred near CIDCO bus stop on Thursday evening. The injured persons are being treated at a hospital and they are out of danger, Avinash Sawant, chief of Thane's Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC), said.

397.title: Zimbabwe reach 2nd stage of T20 World Cup for 1st time in history
397.article_body: Zimbabwe defeated Scotland by five wickets in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Group B first round match in Hobart. With this, they advanced to the second stage of a T20 World Cup for the first time in history. Batting first after winning the toss, Scotland put up a total of 132/6. Zimbabwe chased down the total in 18.3 overs.

398.title: 'Kantara' should be India's entry to Oscars next year: Kangana Ranaut
398.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories and wrote that Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' should be India's entry to the Oscars next year. She added that the film is an "experiential reality which world must experience". Kangana, who watched 'Kantara' on Thursday, in a video message praised Rishab's performance in the film, saying that his writing, direction and acting were "unbelievable".

399.title: Over 66,000 Russian soldiers killed in war so far, says Ukraine
399.article_body: Ukraine on Friday claimed that it has killed about 66,750 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said the country's forces have destroyed 2,573 Russian tanks and over 510 aircraft, including 243 helicopters. About 5,258 armoured personnel carriers, 1,648 artillery systems and 372 multiple launch rocket systems have also been destroyed, it added.

400.title: List of reserved wards for MCD election released
400.article_body: Delhi State Election Commission on Thursday released the list of wards that will be reserved for women and Scheduled Caste (SC) candidates for the upcoming Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) election. Out of the total 250 seats redrawn in the recently-concluded delimitation exercise, 42 have been reserved for SC candidates. Meanwhile, 50% of the overall seats are reserved for women.

401.title: Ajay's character's name in Thank God changed from Chitragupta to CG: Reports
401.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn's character's name in the upcoming movie 'Thank God' has been changed from Chitragupta to CG, according to reports. "The makers felt it was wise to avoid addressing him as Chitragupta...All dialogues where the word Chitragupta was mentioned were replaced with CG," a source was quoted as saying. The film has been passed with a U/A certificate.
